Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with two added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of bull (part of rump with patterned decoration and added red stroke remaining) to right.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the pattern, see New York Metropolitan Museum of Art 55.71.8 from Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0441) (phase 2)
